column4: Hi. I'm trying to launch Virtualbox (headless) from a script at logon (via /etc/init.d/rc.local). If I "run" /etc/init.d/rc.local, it starts Virtualbox but if I reboot, it doesn't. Anyone suggest what might be wrong?
did you supply the full path to virtualbox in rc.local?
no. I can see why that is important ;-)
which is best to use for startup? Or doesn't it matter ?
you'll want to use /etc/rc.local
ok, thanks. I'll try it with the full path, too. Thanks all
are you still here?
yep

I added '/usr/bin/VBoxHeadless -startvm "3b86e497-24fd-4a81-ae5b-4d0a0abd476d"' to my /etc/rc.local and it starts if I "execute" /etc/rc.local but it doesn't start after a reboot. Could you say what is wrong, please?
could you pastebin the whole /etc/rc.local?
http://pastebin.com/m1fd2a887
and the execute permission bit is set for etc/rc.local?
I was running this command inside another script but I thought I'd 'cut out the middleman'. Also, does it need a "nohup" ?
you'll have to check the documentation for the preferred means of headless invocation.
flags are: -rwxr-xr-x
you might try redirecting stdout and stderr to /dev/null.
how do I do that? Also, should I have a message in the log as to why it isn't starting?
try sticking a "&> /dev/null" at the end.
ok thanks. I believe this script is run as root so the permissions are OK, yes? I just find it odd that I can run it via sudo without problems but it never runs at boot up.
permissions are fine, yes.
is there any way of starting that 'runlevel' without rebooting each time ?
man telinit.
ok, thanks
